what-it-does:
Checks for del statements that delete the entire slice of a list or
dictionary.
why-is-this-bad:
It is faster and more succinct to remove all items via the clear()
method.
example:
names = {"key": "value"}
nums = [1, 2, 3]

del names[:]
del nums[:]



Use instead:


names = {"key": "value"}
nums = [1, 2, 3]

names.clear()
nums.clear()

example-split.example-before:
names = {"key": "value"}
nums = [1, 2, 3]

del names[:]
del nums[:]
